thread.title: 2016 GOP response to Obama on "60 Minutes;" Clinton on Black Lives Matter
thread.title_full: 2016 GOP response to Obama on "60 Minutes;" Clinton on Black Lives Matter - CBS News

author: CBS News
title: 2016 GOP response to Obama on "60 Minutes;" Clinton on Black Lives Matter
text:
What are the 2016 presidential candidates saying on the campaign trail? 

Mike Huckabee: Obama is "obsessed with climate change" 
"[T]his president is obsessed with climate change while the rest of the world understands the real danger of Islamic fanaticism. I think that he thinks a sunburn is worse than a beheading and most of us think that's nonsense." -- interviewed on Fox Business 
Huckabee was responding to this quote from President Obama, on Russia's involvement in Syria: 
"[I]f you think that running your economy into the ground and having to send troops in in order to prop up your only ally is leadership, then we've got a different definition of leadership. My definition of leadership would be leading on climate change, an international accord that potentially we'll get in Paris. -- interviewed on CBS News' "60 Minutes" 
Chris Christie: Obama is "weakling in the White House" 
"And this weakling in the White House- who got pushed around last night, by the way, by Steve Kroft. We saw that. I mean pushed around by Kroft. I mean, when Kroft starts pushing the president around because he's basically been his, you know, buddy for the last seven years..."
Donald Trump: "It was all negative" 
"I thought he did not do a good job, I think that our country has nothing but problems, therefore nothing but negative. It was all negative last night on '60 Minutes.' We don't have the victories anymore. We don't have the victories. You have a president who honestly I thought was not good on '60 Minutes' last night." --press gaggle in Manchester, New Hampshire
